    • Method Detail

      • loadPage

        public void loadPage(ContentSource contentSource,
                     Chapter chapter,
                     int page,
                     ReaderController readerController,
                     boolean preloading,
                     int preloading_amount)
        Create a LoaderRunnable for loading a chapter page.
        Parameters:
        contentSource - the ContentSource to load from
        chapter - the Chapter the page is from
        page - the 0-indexed page number
        readerController - the ReaderController to update before/after the page is loaded
        preloading - whether the page is being preloaded or not (loaded before the user gets to the page)
        preloading_amount - the number of subsequent pages to preload, or -1 for infinite
        See Also:
        LoadPageRunnable

      • loadSeries

        public void loadSeries(ContentSource contentSource,
                       java.lang.String source,
                       SearchSeriesController searchSeriesController,
                       LibraryController libraryController)
        Create a LoaderRunnable for loading a series.
        Parameters:
        contentSource - the ContentSource to load from
        source - the source for the series, relative to the ContentSource domain
        searchSeriesController - the SearchSeriesController to report errors to
        libraryController - the LibraryController to update before/after the series is loaded
        See Also:
        LoadSeriesRunnable

      • reloadSeries

        public void reloadSeries(ContentSource contentSource,
                         Series series,
                         boolean quick,
                         SeriesController seriesController)
        Create a LoaderRunnable for reloading an existing series.
        Parameters:
        contentSource - the ContentSource to load from
        series - the series to reload
        quick - whether the list of chapters should be "quickly" reloaded, which ensures that only one total HTTP request is made, but does not guarantee that all chapters are loaded
        seriesController - the SeriesController to update before/after the series is reloaded
        See Also:
        ReloadSeriesRunnable

      • search

        public void search(ContentSource contentSource,
                   java.lang.String query,
                   SearchSeriesController searchSeriesController)
        Create a LoaderRunnable for searching for series'.
        Parameters:
        contentSource - the ContentSource to load from
        query - the text to search for
        searchSeriesController - the SearchSeriesController to update before/after the results are loaded
        See Also:
        SearchRunnable

      • loadBanner

        public void loadBanner(InfoSource infoSource,
                       Series series,
                       SeriesController seriesController)
        Create a LoaderRunnable for loading a series banner.
        Parameters:
        infoSource - the InfoSource to load from
        series - the Series the banner is from
        seriesController - the SeriesController to update after the banner is loaded
        See Also:
        LoadBannerRunnable

      • startThreadSafely

        private void startThreadSafely(java.lang.String name,
                               LoaderRunnable runnable)
        Start a Runnable in a new Thread while ensuring that the name does not overlap with pre-existing threads.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Thread to create
        runnable - the Runnable to run in the Thread

      • stopThreads

        public void stopThreads(java.lang.String prefix)
        Request threads with names starting with the given prefix to stop.

        This method does not guarantee the threads to immediately stop -- it simply calls requestStop() on all matching running LoaderRunnable's.

        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix of the thread names to stop

      • stopAllThreads

        public void stopAllThreads()
        Request all threads to stop.

        This method does not guarantee the threads to immediately stop -- it simply calls requestStop() on all matching running LoaderRunnable's.

      • getRunnables

        public java.util.ArrayList<LoaderRunnable> getRunnables()
